snippet: He left South Africa a proud legacy of freedom and tolerance. Alas, some of his compatriots are trampling on it.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Zakes Mda recalls the Nelson Mandela of his youth, who debated African nationalism in his living room with his father; notes what was striking about Mandela was that he was a man of contradictions; maintains Mandela leaves a proud legacy of freedom and human rights, tolerance and reconciliation; laments some of his compatriots are trampling on that legacy.
lead_paragraph: He left South Africa a proud legacy of freedom and tolerance. Alas, some of his compatriots are trampling on it.
